item.description:
Some folks have asked me to post this so here it is

Car pool over to the best blueberry mountain in Western Maine. one of the few spots with three varieties of wild bluberries. The mountain has 360 degree views of the surrounding area including a large portion of the Western Maine Appalachian Trail and the androscogin river valley. The hike is about 1 to 1 -1/2 hours one way and the plan is to spend at leastÂ 2 hours picking.

Dependent on the groups interest, a stop a Sunday River Brewing on the return trip.

We will meet in Gorham NH and car pool. We can arrange to meet folks from western Maine on the way.

I havent been up there this year but the indicators are good the the berries will be ripe.

This is not a "hard core hike" but the summit is exposed with extensive area of open rock. Plan on sunscreen and lot of water.

A forecast for bad weather cancels the event.
item.how_to_find_us: Meet us neat to the Railroad Museum just off of RT 16 near the junction of RT2 in Gorham NH
item.name: Blueberry Hike -Andover White Cap
